newsitem.title: UK: Blue Circle buys sanitaryware firm Venesta.
newsitem.headline: Blue Circle buys sanitaryware firm Venesta.

text.p: Blue Circle Industries Plc (BCI) said on Monday that it has acquired Venesta Cubicle Systems Ltd, manufacturer of lavatories, showers, changing room cubicles and washroom products for 5.5 million stg.
It said 2.5 million stg of the price would be paid for with the issue of BCI shares in March 1998.
BCI said Venesta would become part of Blue Circle Bathrooms, and would be incorporated into Armitage Shanks as "Armitage Venesta Washrooms Systems.'
Venesta, based in Gravesend, Kent, was bought by its management from Chime Communications in October 1994, in a deal backed by venture capital firm 3i Group.
In the year to March 1996 BCI said Venesta reported profits of 820,000 stg on turnover of 5.61 million stg.

"Venesta's strengths include innovative product designs, in particular for special applications such as schools, and well developed commercial systems," said Michael Schofield, Blue Circle Bathrooms chief executive.
"The substantial synergies between Venesta and the existing Armitage Shanks integrated plumbing systems business...will enable us to strengthen further our market position," he said.
